name: Katharina Reimer
hero-2: und ich interessiere mich für Software.
current-school: ACMS bei der UW ↗
current-job: Full Stack Entwicklerin bei PeakMind ↗
abt1: Ich studiere Mathematik und deren Einfluss auf die Program-Effizienz. Ich bin in der 2. Studienjahr und programmiere selbst sehr gern.
abt2: Seit ich an der Universität Washington eingeschrieben bin, habe ich bewusst besonders herausfordernde Kurse gewählt. Außerdem habe ich viel Erfahrung mit Teamarbeit und Führung durch meine Aktivitäten in Nachhilfe und in der Freiwilligenarbeit.
contact: Interesse? Nehmen Sie bitte Kontakt auf!
con1: Ich möchte Industrie-Erfahrung sammeln und suche andere praktische Gelegenheiten zum Programmieren. Sie können meine bisherigen Projekte einsehen oder mir eine E-Mail auf rinareimer616@gmail.com senden.

project1.title: Seam Carving
project1.desc: Java object-oriented program utilizing Dijkstra's graph algorithm to find the path of pixels with the least energy within an image.
project1.longdesc:
+ Java object-oriented program utilizing Dijkstra's graph algorithm to find the path of pixels with the least energy within an image.
+ 3-week long development stage, building upon CSE 373 curriculum.

project2.title: Electrical Circuit Calculator
project2.desc: Python program that calculates voltages at nodes and current along connections in a given electrical circuit.
project2.longdesc:
+ Python program that calculates voltages at nodes and current along connections in a given electrical circuit.
+ Demonstrates linear algebra expertise with Markdown explanations.

project3.title: BYJU's Capstones
project3.desc: A collection of my Python capstone projects from BYJU's FutureSchool.
project3.longdesc:
+ Excelled in weekly online Python training program, learning machine learning and data modeling techniques.
+ Mastered data cleaning/visualization and statistical representation techniques through over 100 hands-on data analysis projects with large data sets from various international sources.
+ Gained coding experience and deepened knowledge of machine learning models, such as Linear/Logistic Regression, Random Forest Classifier, and Fast Fourier Transformations.

project4.title: Bit Connect
project4.desc: Java application aimed to connect students in person using hypothetical location data and filtered matches between users based on fields of study and interests.
project4.longdesc:
+ Java application aimed to connect students in person using hypothetical location data and filtered matches between users based on fields of study and interests.
+ Teamed with fellow students using Figma, starting the project in WINFO Hackathon 2024 and continuing the implementation with help from industry professionals and self-learning.
+ 9-hour initial build with algorithm architecture draft and three-month deliverable design implementation, utilizing Gradle and the JVM to release documentation on the prototype.

project5.title: PeakMind
project5.desc: Gamified mental health app aimed at giving users accessible and friendly resources, using AI to offer personalized recommendations.
project5.longdesc:
+ Worked on a team to create a gamified mental health app aimed at giving users accessible and friendly resources, using artificial intelligence and natural language processing to offer personalized recommendations.
+ Worked on the front end to convert designs to useable interfaces, quickly picking up SwiftUI and app development.
+ Honed communication skills and time management, working on a team of 7 to deliver on a fast-paced software development cycle, earning top spots in various app design competitions.
+ Spearheaded a feature to track users’ mental health data to give users custom plans using machine learning to analyze the large data set and use various psychology sources to give accurate feedback.

project6.title: PageByPage
project6.desc: Mobile app allowing users to log and find books.
project6.longdesc:
+ Collaborated on a cross-functional team to develop an iOS app to find, log, and review books.
+ Utilized Google Cloud Platform for end-to-end development and Firebase Firestore databases to process user data, accessing book information from the Google Books API.
+ Developed app with Swift and SwiftUI, releasing the app for beta testing on the iPhone app store.+ Completed user research to ensure high customer value and user interface.

class1.title: STAT 390: Statistical Methods in Engineering and Science
class1.desc: Exploratory data analysis and interactive computing using statistical methods in R.

class2.title: CSE 123: Introduction to Computer Programming III

class3.title: AMATH 352: Applied Linear Algebra
class3.desc: LU factorization, QR factorization, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, and singular value decomposition, implemented with Python.

class4.title: CSE 374: Intermediate Programming Concepts and Tools
class4.desc: Lower-level programming and explicit memory management; use of Linux systems for compilation; software development techniques and tools including documentation and code review.

class5.title: CSE 373: Data Structures and Algorithms
class5.desc: Hash tables, priority queues, graphs, balanced trees, asymptotic analysis, and graph algorithms.

class6.title: CSE 413: Programming Languages and Implementation
class6.desc: Concepts/implementation strategies for programming languages; analysis of computer science and computer engineering performance.

class7.title: CSE 414: Introduction to Database Systems
class7.desc: Data models, query languages, transactions, database tuning, data warehousing, and parallelism.
